recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
All driveway permit applications shall comply with the State of New Hampshire's driveway statute, RSA 236:13 and the Claremont Planning Board's requirements. 
All fees must be paid, appropriate signatures attained, and bonds (if required) posted prior to any permit being granted. All highway and right-of-way cuts require the posting of a minimum of $2500.00 bond which will be returned upon DPW approval of the completed activity. Other retainers may be higher, when in the opinion of a DPW superintendent, the activity has the potential of causing greater damage to any portion of the City's infrastructure.

categories.name: Code Enforcement
categories.content: We strive to help make the City of Claremont a safe, healthy and beautiful place to live by actively enforcing the City Codes and Ordinances. We serve the citizens of The City of Claremont by ensuring compliance through  effective public contact and education, building cooperative partnerships and rapport throughout our community, and enforcing the law in an equitable and impartial manner to the greater benefit of the entire City.
